headline: A Look At Marriott International (MAR) Valuation After Strong Recent Share Price Momentum
summary: Marriott International (MAR) has drawn investor interest after recent performance data showed a 9.9% move over the past month and 24.7% over the past 3 months, with the stock last closing at US$328.18. See our latest analysis for Marriott International. That recent 9.9% 1 month share price return and 24.7% 3 month share price return come on top of a 22.4% 1 year total shareholder return and a 168.4% 5 year total shareholder return. This combination suggests momentum has been strong over both...

headline: Is It Too Late To Consider Marriott International (MAR) After A 22% One-Year Rally?
summary: If you are wondering whether Marriott International is still fairly priced after a strong run, or if the current share price is getting ahead of itself, this article is for you. The stock last closed at US$328.18, with returns of 4.7% over the past week, 9.9% over the past month, 4.7% year to date, 22.4% over 1 year, 109.1% over 3 years and 168.4% over 5 years. These figures naturally raise questions about value at today's level. Recent attention on travel and hospitality brands, including...

headline: Will Marriott’s New Regional Leadership Structure Subtly Reframe Its Asset-Light Strategy Narrative for MAR?
summary: Earlier this week, Marriott International announced that long-time leaders Liam Brown and Brian King will retire in 2026, while Satya Anand, Neal Jones, and Federico “Fede” Greppi will assume expanded regional leadership roles across the U.S., Canada, Caribbean and Latin America, and EMEA. This reshuffle unifies major regions under experienced insiders, signaling Marriott’s emphasis on continuity of its asset-light growth model and closer alignment between global operations and regional...

headline: Israeli cyber startup Torq raises $140 million at $1.2 billion valuation
summary: Israeli cyber startup Torq said on Sunday ​it raised $140 million at a $1.2 ‌billion valuation, as it looks to speed ‌up adoption of its artificial intelligence-driven security operations center (SOC) platform and expand into the U.S. market. Torq, ⁠which uses ‌AI to provide security protection for companies, has now ‍raised a total of $332 million since its inception in 2020. "This funding accelerates our ​mission to define and dominate ‌the AI SOC market," said Ofer Smadari, CEO and co-founder, Torq.
